channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Parts of Gaza in ‘Full-Blown Famine,’ U.N. Aid Official Says
item.description: Cindy McCain, the director of the World Food Program, said starvation is entrenched in northern Gaza and is “moving its way south.”

item.title: Parts of Gaza in ‘Full-Blown Famine,’ U.N. Aid Official Says
item.description: Cindy McCain, the director of the World Food Program, said starvation is entrenched in northern Gaza and is “moving its way south.”

item.title: Gas stove pollution harms poor and minority Americans the most, due in part to different home sizes, study says
item.description: The researchers estimated that gas and propane stoves contribute to as many as 19,000 adult deaths annually in the US, as well as 200,000 childhood asthma cases and $1 billion in societal harm.

item.title: Donald J. Trump’s Scandals Captivate the Court, but Hush-Money Case Hangs on Dry Details
item.description: Prosecutors started their criminal case against Donald J. Trump with eye-catching and lurid stories, but the heart of the matter is invoices and ledger entries.

item.title: Charges Against Cuellar Lay Bare Azerbaijan’s Influence Attempts
item.description: Federal prosecutors say Representative Henry Cuellar tried to shape policy for Azerbaijan in exchange for bribes. The country has spent millions in the past decade lobbying Washington.

item.title: Social-media sensation 'Shug' the zebra is recaptured after evading a rodeo clown and horse trainers to spend nearly a week on the run
item.description: Local residents and animal control officers corralled "Shug" in the community of Riverbend, about 30 miles east of Seattle.

item.title: The Best Hats at the 2024 Kentucky Derby
item.description: America’s most famous horse race may be celebrating a milestone this year, but the hats are the real stars of the show.

item.title: The Bleak Life in Captivity of Niger’s Deposed President, Mohamed Bazoum
item.description: Nine months after a coup in Niger, Mohamed Bazoum, an ally of France and the U.S., remains locked in the presidential residence, cut off from contact with anyone but his doctor.

item.title: Are cold plunges and saunas safe for kids? What parents need to know about the benefits and risks
item.description: More adults have been incorporating saunas and cold plunges into their wellness routines, and increasingly, their kids are, too.

item.title: Frank Stella, Towering Artist and Master of Reinvention, Dies at 87
item.description: He moved American art away from Abstract Expressionism toward cool minimalism. His explorations of color and form were endlessly discussed and constantly on exhibit.

item.title: Canadian Arrests Highlight Alleged Gang Role in India’s Intelligence Operations
item.description: India’s external spy agency, the Research and Analysis Wing, has long been accused of tapping into criminal networks to carry out operations in South Asia. Is the agency now doing similar operations in the West?

item.title: The NCAA and top college conferences could pay $3 billion and share revenue with athletes to settle an antitrust lawsuit
item.description: Schools in the Big Ten, Big 12, Atlantic Coast Conference and Southeastern Conference could be on the hook for about $30 million per year, which would include about $20 million annually directed to their athletes.

item.title: Charges Against Cuellar Lay Bare Azerbaijan’s Influence Attempts
item.description: Federal prosecutors say Representative Henry Cuellar tried to shape policy for Azerbaijan in exchange for bribes. The country has spent millions in the past decade lobbying Washington.

item.title: Sadiq Khan Re-elected Mayor of London in Latest Win for Labour Party
item.description: Mr. Khan defeated a right-wing rival who focused on crime and cars, his victory another ominous sign for Britain’s ruling Conservatives ahead of a general election.

item.title: India and Japan hit back at Joe Biden's comments calling them 'xenophobic' countries like Russia and China
item.description: Biden made the remarks during a campaign fundraising event on Wednesday.
